meta.name: description
meta.content: The 308 Permanent Redirect HTTP status code tells clients to update references with the old URI, then re-issue the request at a different URI.

main.p: The 308 Permanent Redirect HTTP status code tells clients the request was not filled, but the resource has been moved to another location; the client must update references with the old URI and re-issue the request at the new URI to complete the operation.
Servers should produce 308 Permanent Redirect when a resource or set of resources has been assigned a new URI, especially one at a different authority/origin server.
308 redirects can typically be configured as a search-and-replace on the request-URI.
For a period of time, servers should instead issue 307 Temporary Redirect, so that if there is an error in the redirect, it won't cause clients to adjust their bookmarks to a URI that doesn't exist.
308 Permanent Redirect is an indication the client should adjust references to a different URI. If the client has any bookmarks, they should first be updated to the new URI.
Then, the request should be re-tried at the URI.
The server doesn't necessarially know anything about the target URI; the request at the redirect target might fail, but this doesn't change handling of the 308 response.

dl.dd: The resource has moved to a different URI and the request must be re-made.

dd.a: RFC 7538: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol Status Code 308 (Permanent Redirect)
